词汇结构.title: She felt she needed time to __________ on what to do next.
If darkness or night __________, it becomes dark and day changes to night.
In the second experiment they __________ a very clear result.
Our boxes are in __________and should arrive tomorrow.
They were making a __________ amount of noise last night.
The foundations will have to be __________ to prevent the house from sinking further into the ground.
They're ______ to socialize with a very small circle of people.
Consultants who have easy access to the president are those who have _______ the president.
option: permission to approach or communicate with
a means of entering or approaching
词汇结构.result: permission to approach or communicate with

词汇结构.title: She's too smart to fall into the ______ of working without pay.
The politician attempts to keep the favor of the voters. The word 'favor' here means _______.
The crowd ______ mostly of college kids and office workers.
A person who is slippery is someone you feel _______.
The company is being widely ______ in the media for failing to limit air pollution.
This is an opportunity to __________ the reputation of the company.
If you ______ people for an organization, you select them and persuade them to join it or work for it.
The new tax caused a huge __________ of public anger in America.
Your ______ are the people who are the same age as you or who have the same status as you.
Our trade union has __________ the introduction of automation.
John's problems were ____________ by his lack of concentration.
Children challenge their parents' _________ far more nowadays than they did in the past.
In the first _________ , the camera moves slowly across the room.
She seemed __________ in her commitment to finish school.
There seems to be a lack of _________ among the employees.
They decided to remove their son from the school. The word 'remove' here means _____.
option: to make a negative feeling disappear
to take something or someone away from somewhere
to take something or someone off something
to accept something or someone from somewhere
词汇结构.result: to take something or someone away from somewhere

词汇结构.title: Too _________ the eyes.
His main objective this semester is to improve his grades. The word 'objective' here means _____.
option: not influenced by personal feelings or beliefs
something that he aims to do or achieve
词汇结构.result: something that he aims to do or achieve

词汇结构.title: The material that resists heat will_____.
option: not be harmed or damaged by heat
be harmed or damaged by heat
词汇结构.result: not be harmed or damaged by heat

词汇结构.title: The factory replaced most of its workers with robots. The word 'replace' here means _____.
option: to put something back where it was before
to take the place of something or somebody
to change something that is old for a similar thing that is newer
to express one's welcome to somebody
词汇结构.result: to take the place of something or somebody

词汇结构.title: He threatened to complain of him to the captain. The word 'complain' here means _______.
option: to express grief, pain or discontent
to make a formal accusation or charge
to say that you are suffering from a pain
词汇结构.result: to make a formal accusation or charge

词汇结构.title: We must wish ourselves good fortune in our __________.
The proper thing is the one that is correct or most ______ .
Mexico gained its __________ from Spain in 1821.
Translators can now work from home, via electronic mail systems, which means that translators can work ______ electronic mail systems
Think about which times of day your __________ is highest, and do the most difficult tasks then.
He gave a ______ promise.
An ongoing investigation is an investigation that is _____.
It is at your ______ to take it or leave it.
It was a blessing that no one was killed in the accident. The word 'blessing' here means _____.
option: a prayer asking for God's help
approval someone gives to the action
something that is finished fading completely

词汇结构.title: If something ______, it changes.
That I'm not hooked into the political circles means I _____ it.
Good ______ is essential if patients are to make a quick recovery.
A _____ is someone who has been doing a job or other activity for only a short time and so is not experienced at it.
I can't afford it; it's too expensive. The word 'afford' here means ______.
A crucial time is extremely ________.
His life ______ around football.
The place looks more prosperous or ________ than ever.
His most recent business ______ ended in bankruptcy.
To generate a form of energy or power means to _______ it.
The company plans to ______ $325 million in its new plant.
The panel discussion on cultural exchanges _________ the importance of people-to-people relations.
The problems were ______ in the area's history.
The attainment of a goal is the act of ______.
A temporary contract is a contract that ______.
option: lasts only for a short period of time
change something that is old for a similar thing that is newer
词汇结构.result: lasts only for a short period of time

词汇结构.title: The money is intended to be used for ______ purposes.
My memory of childhood ______ as time goes by.
America's trade ___ widened.
The plan looks all right in principle, but in practice it wouldn't be _____.
Much of the instability _____ from the economic effects of the war.
Treatment is ______ to the needs of each patient.
Students hoped for more __________ than an announcement in the school paper of their achievement.
Peak times are the times when ______.
option: most people are using or doing something
词汇结构.result: most people are using or doing something

词汇结构.title: Debt is not necessarily a bad thing if the consumer can __________ to pay it back.
The earthquake survivors are in __________ need of help.
Over the years the church has fallen into a state of __________.
If you __________ away all the rhetoric, you're left with an opinion that isn't backed up by facts.
The organization was formed to __________ the needs of older people.
These people were deported because they posed a threat to national __________.
The company said the debt was __________ during its acquisition of nine individual businesses.
A helicopter __________ the final section of the bridge into place.
The road was closed while the _________ that had been involved in the accident were towed away.

阅读理解.title: Our long-term goals mean a lot____.
option: if we complete our short-range goals
if we cannot reach solid short-term goals
if we write down the dates
if we put forward some plans
阅读理解.result: if we complete our short-range goals

阅读理解.title: New short-term goals will build upon____.
option: the goals that have been completed.
阅读理解.result: the goals that have been completed.

阅读理解.title: The intermediate goals____.
option: build on the foundation of the short-range goals
allow you to become discouraged or overwhelmed
阅读理解.result: build on the foundation of the short-range goals

阅读理解.title: When we complete each step of our goals, ____.
option: we will build up confidence of success
we have a strong desire for setting new goals
阅读理解.result: we will build up confidence of success

阅读理解.title: It is implied but not stated in the passage that____.
option: those who have long-term goals will succeed
writing down the dates may discourage you
the goal is only a guide for us to reach our destination
阅读理解.result: the goal is only a guide for us to reach our destination

阅读理解.title: What is the passage mainly about?
option: The scientific guide on how to take action.
The scientific guide on how to make a schedule.
The scientific guide on how to get and stay motivated.
The scientific guide on how to get started.
阅读理解.result: The scientific guide on how to get and stay motivated.

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is true according to the passage?
option: Setting a schedule for yourself is always simple.
Sometimes it’s hard to figure out how to motivate yourself?
Motivation cannot compel you to take action at all.
阅读理解.result: Sometimes it’s hard to figure out how to motivate yourself?

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is NOT mentioned in the passage?
option: When you don’t like doing something, just ignore it.
Many people struggle to find the motivation.
A ritual provides a mindless way to initiate your behavior.
General willingness to do something is called motivation.
阅读理解.result: When you don’t like doing something, just ignore it.

阅读理解.title: When we are motivated, it is easier to      .
option: bear the pain of remaining the same
display a willingness to do something
阅读理解.result: bear the inconvenience of action

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is NOT true about motivation?
option: It is often easier to finish a task than it was to start it in the first place.
Motivation is often the cause of an action.
Motivation often comes after starting a new behavior.
Getting started is a form of active inspiration.
阅读理解.result: Motivation is often the cause of an action.

阅读理解.title: To whom does success come certainly?
option: Great people who are remembered for their great achievements.
People who are sincere, hardworking, loyal and committed to their goals.
People who have a strong motivation.
阅读理解.result: People who are sincere, hardworking, loyal and committed to their goals.

阅读理解.title: Which one is NOT the basic thing in life we need to achieve success?
阅读理解.result: Application.

阅读理解.title: Which word can best explain the meaning of 'stamina' in Paragraph2?
阅读理解.result: Endurance.

阅读理解.title: Lack of high spirit leads to _____.
option: a feeling that you are not as good as others
the construction of the path to success
a struggle on the path to success
阅读理解.result: a feeling that you are not as good as others

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is true according to the passage?
option: Desire is the driving force that decides the success.
All great people have a strong motivation.
Failures are the stepping-stones of success.
Every success has a ratio of five percent perspiration and ninety-five percent inspiration.
阅读理解.result: Failures are the stepping-stones of success.

阅读理解.title: What does the underlined word 'formula' (Para.1) mean?
option: Qualities or talents needed for success.
The principle observed to achieve a result.
The methods used to achieve success.
阅读理解.result: The principle observed to achieve a result.

阅读理解.title: It can be inferred from the passage that a successful businessman_______.
option: tries to get experience through practice
pays attention to the essence of a problem when he tries to solve it
keeps on learning in order to be successful
has strong willpower, extensive interest and intelligence
阅读理解.result: pays attention to the essence of a problem when he tries to solve it

阅读理解.title: According to the oil man, common sense can be acquired through______.
阅读理解.result: debate

阅读理解.title: What can be inferred from the passage?
option: Different people have different interpretations of common sense.
Common sense has nothing to do with one’s talent.
If you have enough common sense, you can succeed.
Common sense can only be developed through yourself.
阅读理解.result: Different people have different interpretations of common sense.

阅读理解.title: The passage is mainly concerned with____.
option: organizational ability and good work habits
the way to obtain big profits and achieve fame and success
knowledge and interest which are primary to success
what successful people have in common
阅读理解.result: what successful people have in common

阅读理解.title: What can the immune system do?
option: Collect structures and processes within the body.
Tell various threats to the body apart from the body's own healthy tissue.
阅读理解.result: Tell various threats to the body apart from the body's own healthy tissue.

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is NOT true about innate immunity?
option: It consists of barriers that keep out external threats.
The cough reflex is part of innate immunity.
It doesn’t protect against any threats.
阅读理解.result: It doesn’t protect against any threats.

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is NOT true about adaptive immunity?
option: It targets specific threats to the body.
People are not born with it.
It works more efficiently towards any threat than innate immunity.
It is more complex than innate immunity.
阅读理解.result: It works more efficiently towards any threat than innate immunity.

阅读理解.title: What does “neutralize”(Para. 4) mean?
阅读理解.result: Have no effect.

阅读理解.title: Which is the best title for the passage?
option: Differences Between Innate Immunity and Adaptive Immunity
阅读理解.result: The Immune System

阅读理解.title: Which is NOT true about the new study mentioned in the passage?
option: Its results were presented Sunday at the American Heart Association Scientific Sessions in Anaheim, California.
It is the first study to find a link between prolonged TV viewing and heart disease involving blocked arteries.
It suggests that watching too much television increases the risk of potentially fatal blood clots.
It is the first study in a Western population to look at VTE.
阅读理解.result: It is the first study to find a link between prolonged TV viewing and heart disease involving blocked arteries.

阅读理解.title: What is suggested about watching TV according to the passage?
option: Taking snacks and sitting still while watching TV.
Doing some exercise while watching TV.
阅读理解.result: Doing some exercise while watching TV.

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is NOT true about VTE?
option: It is the most common vascular diagnosis.
Each year, about 300,000 to 600,000 people in the US develop this disease.
Watching too much television increases the risk of it.
It is blood clots in the veins of the legs, arms, pelvis and lungs.
阅读理解.result: It is the most common vascular diagnosis.

阅读理解.title: How can people lower the risk of VTE?
阅读理解.result: All of the above.

阅读理解.title: What does “prolonged” (Para. 3) mean?
阅读理解.result: Continuing for a long time.

阅读理解.title: How many techniques are provided in this passage?
What does the word “repertoire” (Para. 2) mean?
option: A method that involves practical skills.
The skill with which someone is able to do something practical.
All the things that a person is able to do.
阅读理解.result: All the things that a person is able to do.

阅读理解.title: Which is NOT a possible personal barrier according to the passage?
option: Selecting the alternative with the least risk.
Accepting the information you get as it is.
阅读理解.result: Considering some alternatives honestly.

阅读理解.title: Why should we talk with experienced persons about their problem-solving approach?
option: Because they may tell you about their own problem-solving approach.
Because you can learn skills from them.
Because you can gain a lot of insight from them.
Because they may discuss your thought process.
阅读理解.result: Because you can gain a lot of insight from them.

阅读理解.title: What can we infer from the passage?
option: Read biographies of leaders of social movements, businesses, and the military.
Problem-solving can only be developed through practice.
Pretend you are the decision-maker in tough issues, and work through what you would do.
Examine your own personal barriers in being an effective problem-solver.
阅读理解.result: Problem-solving can only be developed through practice.

阅读理解.title: What is the passage mainly about?
option: Rational versus organic approach to problem-solving.
阅读理解.result: Rational versus organic approach to problem-solving.

阅读理解.title: Which of the following is a rational to problem-solving?
option: Examining all potential causes for the problem.
Identifying all alternatives to resolve the problem.
阅读理解.result: All of the above.

阅读理解.title: What is the advantage of the rational approach to problem-solving?
option: It gives a strong sense of order in a chaotic situation.
It provides a common frame of reference from which people can communicate in the situation.
It is highly adaptable to understanding and explaining the chaotic changes.
It suits the nature of people who shun linear and mechanistic approaches to projects.
阅读理解.result: It provides a common frame of reference from which people can communicate in the situation.

阅读理解.title: Where does the quality of an organization or life come from?
option: Having fixed a lot of problems.
阅读理解.result: The ongoing process of trying.

阅读理解.title: What is the disadvantage of the organic approach to problem-solving?
option: The world is much too chaotic for the approach to be useful.
It provides no clear frame of reference for people to solve problems.
It can take a long time to finish.
It is not an approach to organizational consulting.
阅读理解.result: It provides no clear frame of reference for people to solve problems.
